item.title: Don't Take VC Funding â€“ It Will Destroy Your Company
item.description: - VC funding is not a guarantee of success and may actually indicate a company's inability to be profitable on its own.

item.title: How small is the smallest .NET Hello World binary?
item.description: - The author explores how small a .NET Hello World binary can be in terms of file size while still functioning as a normal executable on a Windows machine.

item.title: PoisonGPT: We hid a lobotomized LLM on Hugging Face to spread fake news
item.description: - This article discusses the potential dangers of using Large Language Models (LLMs) and the need for a secure LLM supply chain with model provenance to ensure AI safety.

item.title: InfluxDB Cloud shuts down in Belgium; some weren't notified before data deletion
item.description: - Users of InfluxDB Cloud in Belgium experienced issues with missing or incomplete data on their dashboards.

item.title: Using Lidar to map tree shadows
item.description: - The author has developed a website called ShadeMap that simulates tree shadows using LiDAR data.

item.title: Sarah Silverman is suing OpenAI & Meta for copyright infringement
item.description: - Comedian Sarah Silverman and authors Christopher Golden and Richard Kadrey are suing OpenAI and Meta for copyright infringement, alleging that the companies trained their AI models on illegally-acquired datasets containing their works without their consent.

item.title: California needs real math education, not gimmicks
item.description: - The education system in California is facing challenges in teaching mathematics effectively.

item.title: Amateurs obsess over tools, pros over mastery
item.description: - In a world where people are constantly obsessed with new tools and technologies, true mastery and skill are what matter most, not the tools themselves.

item.title: Defecting from North Korea is now harder
item.description: - A North Korean software engineer trapped in China attempted to escape to South Korea with the help of a South Korean pastor.

item.title: Perl first commit: a "replacement" for Awk & sed
item.description: - Perl is a programming language that is designed to make awk and sed semi-obsolete.
